Description: Two joining sherds of body of Attic red-figured pottery askos, with root of spout. Griffins to either side of top, one nearly fully preserved, the other only a head and paw.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 106 no. 376 pl. 79)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1207)
